comments:
eclipse-SDK-I20040520-win32.zip

when trying to restore the state of a cheatSheet, calling 
viewer.getCheatSheetID(); when the displayed cheatSheet was an error page (... 
contact cheatSheet person..) returs null, and so saving state fails

I have a fix for the NPE but I would like to understand how you arrived at this 
problem. Do you have any steps that I can follow to reproduce problem and 
correctly test my proposed fix?

apologies Lorne, this got lost in my emails.
I got this error when I was implmenting Memento support in CheatSheets.
If you set the cheatSheet input to a bad cheatSheet id, you will get the error 
cheatsheet page I mentioned above. Now if you save the workbench, wiht this 
error page still open, I try to cache the id of the current cheatsheet in the 
memento. This is why I call getInput() on cheatsheet. Bingo, the error.

To reproduce, in any of our IntroUrl commands that open up a cheatSheet, use a 
bad cheatsheet id, get the error page, and close workbench.

btw, setting the cheatSheet input to null also fails. It would be better if 
null input was handled more gracefully.
Dejan, can you please vote for this bug to be fix.

Created an attachment (id=12307)
Patch show fix for bug
The fix for this bug has been released to HEAD.
